messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Community
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/6/03 3:38:34 PM, abtleo@earthlink.net writes:  How did you get so WISE?!  Darn, you re good! :)  Your insight is ...
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/6/03 3:38:34 PM, abtleo@... writes:

<< > How did you get so WISE?! Darn, you're good! :) Your insight is
> always remarkable.
>

<<I think it's because she lives someplace warm. >>

I thought that was supposed to make me lazy.

My suspicion of school-marketting comes from having read lots while I was
teaching. The arguments used to get kids into private schools are always
fascinating to me. The arguments used to get kids into ANY school, I've
made myself when I was a young and gung-ho teacher. I talked my cousin Nada,
who grew up with me in the same house, in the same bedroom most of the time,
out of homeschooling when we were young hippies and she was making babies and
I was teaching school.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Community
messages.msgSnippet: ... I think it s because she lives someplace warm.  All the hot air is outside, so her head is filled with the good stuff. The army always seems to send us to
messages.messageBody:
1/6/03 19:47:

> Sandra,
>
> How did you get so WISE?! Darn, you're good! :) Your insight is
> always remarkable.
>
> Sheila

I think it's because she lives someplace warm. All the hot air is outside,
so her head is filled with the good stuff.

The army always seems to send us to cold, wet places, so all the hot air
occupies my head instead! ;)

brenda
(that's my excuse, and I'm sticking with it!)
